abstract.p: Amvescap PLC, leading manager of publicly traded mutual funds, is in talks to buy control of Canada's sixth-largest mutual fund company, Trimark Financial Corp of Toronto; Amvescap is expected to pay $1.8 billion in cash and stock; graph (S)

block.p: A leading manager of publicly traded mutual funds, Amvescap P.L.C. of London, said it was in talks to buy control of Canada's sixth-largest mutual fund company, the Trimark Financial Corporation of Toronto. People in the market said they expected Amvescap to pay $1.8 billion in cash and stock for Trimark. If a deal is completed, Trimark will be paired with Amvescap's Canadian subsidiary, AIM Funds Management Inc. They have combined assets of $23 billion.
